  16. ‌let mk_a f =
  17.   "-a", Arg.Unit f, " Build a library"

  19. ‌let mk_alert f =
  20.   "-alert", Arg.String f,
  21.   Printf.sprintf
  22.     "<list>  Enable or disable alerts according to <list>:\n\
  23.     \        +<alertname>  enable alert <alertname>\n\
  24.     \        -<alertname>  disable alert <alertname>\n\
  25.     \        ++<alertname> treat <alertname> as fatal error\n\
  26.     \        --<alertname> treat <alertname> as non-fatal\n\
  27.     \        @<alertname>  enable <alertname> and treat it as fatal error\n\
  28.     \    <alertname> can be 'all' to refer to all alert names";;

  93. let mk_function_sections f =
  94.   if Config.function_sections then
  95.     "-function-sections",  Arg.Unit f,
  96.     " Generate each function in a separate section if target supports it"
  97.   else
  98.     let err () =
  99.       raise (Arg.Bad "OCaml has been configured without support for \
  100.                       -function-sections")
  101.     in
  102.     "-function-sections", Arg.Unit err, " (option not available)"

  104. let mk_stop_after ~native f =
  105.   let pass_names = Clflags.Compiler_pass.available_pass_names
  106.                      ~filter:(fun _ -> true)
  107.                      ~native
  108.   in
  109.   "-stop-after", Arg.Symbol (pass_names, f),
  110.   " Stop after the given compilation pass."

  112. let mk_save_ir_after ~native f =
  113.   let pass_names =
  114.     Clflags.Compiler_pass.(available_pass_names
  115.                              ~filter:can_save_ir_after
  116.                              ~native)
  117.   in
  118.   "-save-ir-after", Arg.Symbol (pass_names, f),
  119.   " Save intermediate representation after the given compilation pass\
  120.     (may be specified more than once)."

  172. let mk_dump_pass f =
  173.   "-dump-pass", Arg.String f,
  174.   Format.asprintf
  175.     " @[<4>Record transformations performed by these passes:@ @[%a@]@]"
  176.     (Format.pp_print_list
  177.        ~pp_sep:Format.pp_print_space
  178.        Format.pp_print_string)
  179.     !Clflags.all_passes

  186.     significantly increase code size and compilation time)"

  188. let mk_rounds f =
  189.   "-rounds", Arg.Int f,
  190.     Printf.sprintf "<n>  Repeat tree optimization and inlining phases this \
  191.         many times (default %d).  Rounds are numbered starting from zero."
  192.       !Clflags.default_simplify_rounds

  194. let mk_inline_max_unroll f =
  195.   "-inline-max-unroll", Arg.String f,
  196.     Printf.sprintf "<n>|<round>=<n>[,...]  Unroll recursive functions at most \
  197.       this many times (default %d)"
  198.       Clflags.default_inline_max_unroll

  200. let mk_classic_inlining f =
  201.   "-Oclassic", Arg.Unit f, " Make inlining decisions at function definition \
  202.      time rather than at the call site (replicates previous behaviour of the \
  203.      compiler)"

  205. let mk_inline_cost arg descr default f =
  206.   Printf.sprintf "-inline-%s-cost" arg,
  207.   Arg.String f,
  208.   Printf.sprintf "<n>|<round>=<n>[,...]  The cost of not removing %s during \
  209.       inlining (default %d, higher numbers more costly)"
  210.     descr
  211.     default

  213. let mk_inline_call_cost =
  214.   mk_inline_cost "call" "a call" Clflags.default_inline_call_cost
  215. let mk_inline_alloc_cost =
  216.   mk_inline_cost "alloc" "an allocation" Clflags.default_inline_alloc_cost
  217. let mk_inline_prim_cost =
  218.   mk_inline_cost "prim" "a primitive" Clflags.default_inline_prim_cost
  219. let mk_inline_branch_cost =
  220.   mk_inline_cost "branch" "a conditional" Clflags.default_inline_branch_cost
  221. let mk_inline_indirect_cost =
  222.   mk_inline_cost "indirect" "an indirect call"
  223.     Clflags.default_inline_indirect_cost

  225. let mk_inline_lifting_benefit f =
  226.   "-inline-lifting-benefit",
  227.   Arg.String f,
  228.   Printf.sprintf "<n>|<round>=<n>[,...]  The benefit of lifting definitions \
  229.     to toplevel during inlining (default %d, higher numbers more beneficial)"
  230.     Clflags.default_inline_lifting_benefit

  232. let mk_inline_branch_factor f =

  234.     Printf.sprintf "<n>|<round>=<n>[,...]  Estimate the probability of a \
  235.         branch being cold as 1/(1+n) (used for inlining) (default %.2f)"
  236.     Clflags.default_inline_branch_factor

  527. let mk_w f =
  528.   "-w", Arg.String f,
  529.   Printf.sprintf
  530.   "<list>  Enable or disable warnings according to <list>:\n\
  531.   \        +<spec>   enable warnings in <spec>\n\
  532.   \        -<spec>   disable warnings in <spec>\n\
  533.   \        @<spec>   enable warnings in <spec> and treat them as errors\n\
  534.   \     <spec> can be:\n\
  535.   \        <num>             a single warning number\n\
  536.   \        <num1>..<num2>    a range of consecutive warning numbers\n\
  537.   \        <letter>          a predefined set\n\
  538.   \     default setting is %S" Warnings.defaults_w

  540. let mk_warn_error f =
  541.   "-warn-error", Arg.String f,
  542.   Printf.sprintf
  543.   "<list>  Enable or disable error status for warnings according\n\
  544.   \     to <list>.  See option -w for the syntax of <list>.\n\
  545.   \     Default setting is %S" Warnings.defaults_warn_error

  547. let mk_warn_help f =
  548.   "-warn-help", Arg.Unit f, " Show description of warning numbers"

  550. let mk_color f =
  551.   "-color", Arg.Symbol (["auto"; "always"; "never"], f),
  552.   Printf.sprintf
  553.   "  Enable or disable colors in compiler messages\n\
  554.   \    The following settings are supported:\n\
  555.   \      auto    use heuristics to enable colors only if supported\n\
  556.   \      always  enable colors\n\
  557.   \      never   disable colors\n\
  558.   \    The default setting is 'auto', and the current heuristic\n\
  559.   \    checks that the TERM environment variable exists and is\n\
  560.   \    not empty or \"dumb\", and that isatty(stderr) holds.\n\
  561.   \  If the option is not specified, these setting can alternatively\n\
  562.   \  be set through the OCAML_COLOR environment variable."

  564. let mk_error_style f =
  565.   "-error-style", Arg.Symbol (["contextual"; "short"], f),
  566.   Printf.sprintf
  567.     "  Control the way error messages and warnings are printed\n\
  568.     \    The following settings are supported:\n\
  569.     \      short       only print the error and its location\n\
  570.     \      contextual  like \"short\", but also display the source code\n\
  571.     \                  snippet corresponding to the location of the error\n\
  572.     \    The default setting is 'contextual'.\n\
  573.     \  If the option is not specified, these setting can alternatively\n\
  574.     \  be set through the OCAML_ERROR_STYLE environment variable."

  576. let mk_where f =
  577.   "-where", Arg.Unit f, " Print location of standard library and exit"

  579. let mk_nopervasives f =
  580.   "-nopervasives", Arg.Unit f, " (undocumented)"

  582. let mk_match_context_rows f =
  583.   "-match-context-rows", Arg.Int f,
  584.   let[@manual.ref "s:comp-options"] chapter, section = 13, 2 in
  585.   Printf.sprintf
  586.   "<n>  (advanced, see manual section %d.%d.)" chapter section

  588. let mk_use_prims f =
  589.   "-use-prims", Arg.String f, "<file>  (undocumented)"

  591. let mk_dump_into_file f =
  592.   "-dump-into-file", Arg.Unit f, " dump output like -dlambda into <target>.dump"

  594. let mk_dump_dir f =
  595.   "-dump-dir", Arg.String f,
  596.   "<dir> dump output like -dlambda into <dir>/<target>.dump"

  598. let mk_dparsetree f =
  599.   "-dparsetree", Arg.Unit f, " (undocumented)"

  601. let mk_dtypedtree f =
  602.   "-dtypedtree", Arg.Unit f, " (undocumented)"

  604. let mk_dshape f =
  605.   "-dshape", Arg.Unit f, " (undocumented)"

  607. let mk_drawlambda f =
  608.   "-drawlambda", Arg.Unit f, " (undocumented)"

  610. let mk_dno_unique_ids f =
  611.   "-dno-unique-ids", Arg.Unit f, " (undocumented)"

  613. let mk_dunique_ids f =
  614.   "-dunique-ids", Arg.Unit f, " (undocumented)"

  616. let mk_dno_locations f =
  617.   "-dno-locations", Arg.Unit f, " (undocumented)"

  619. let mk_dlocations f =
  620.   "-dlocations", Arg.Unit f, " (undocumented)"

  622. let mk_dsource f =
  623.   "-dsource", Arg.Unit f, " (undocumented)"

  625. let mk_dlambda f =
  626.   "-dlambda", Arg.Unit f, " (undocumented)"

  628. let mk_drawclambda f =
  629.   "-drawclambda", Arg.Unit f, " (undocumented)"

  631. let mk_dclambda f =
  632.   "-dclambda", Arg.Unit f, " (undocumented)"

  634. let mk_dflambda f =
  635.   "-dflambda", Arg.Unit f, " Print Flambda terms"

  637. let mk_drawflambda f =
  638.   "-drawflambda", Arg.Unit f, " Print Flambda terms after closure conversion"

  640. let mk_dflambda_invariants f =
  641.   "-dflambda-invariants", Arg.Unit f, " Check Flambda invariants \
  642.       around each pass"

  644. let mk_dflambda_no_invariants f =
  645.   "-dflambda-no-invariants", Arg.Unit f, " Do not Check Flambda invariants \
  646.       around each pass"

  648. let mk_dflambda_let f =
  649.   "-dflambda-let", Arg.Int f, "<stamp>  Print when the given Flambda [Let] \
  650.       is created"

  652. let mk_dflambda_verbose f =
  653.   "-dflambda-verbose", Arg.Unit f, " Print Flambda terms including around \
  654.       each pass"

  656. let mk_dinstr f =
  657.   "-dinstr", Arg.Unit f, " (undocumented)"

  659. let mk_dcamlprimc f =
  660.   "-dcamlprimc", Arg.Unit f, " (undocumented)"

  662. let mk_dcmm_invariants f =
  663.   "-dcmm-invariants", Arg.Unit f, " Extra sanity checks on Cmm"

  665. let mk_dcmm f =
  666.   "-dcmm", Arg.Unit f, " (undocumented)"

  668. let mk_dsel f =
  669.   "-dsel", Arg.Unit f, " (undocumented)"

  671. let mk_dcombine f =
  672.   "-dcombine", Arg.Unit f, " (undocumented)"

  674. let mk_dcse f =
  675.   "-dcse", Arg.Unit f, " (undocumented)"

  677. let mk_dlive f =
  678.   "-dlive", Arg.Unit f, " (undocumented)"

  680. let mk_dspill f =
  681.   "-dspill", Arg.Unit f, " (undocumented)"

  683. let mk_dsplit f =
  684.   "-dsplit", Arg.Unit f, " (undocumented)"

  686. let mk_dinterf f =
  687.   "-dinterf", Arg.Unit f, " (undocumented)"

  689. let mk_dprefer f =
  690.   "-dprefer", Arg.Unit f, " (undocumented)"

  692. let mk_dalloc f =
  693.   "-dalloc", Arg.Unit f, " (undocumented)"

  695. let mk_dreload f =
  696.   "-dreload", Arg.Unit f, " (undocumented)"

  698. let mk_dscheduling f =
  699.   "-dscheduling", Arg.Unit f, " (undocumented)"

  701. let mk_dlinear f =
  702.   "-dlinear", Arg.Unit f, " (undocumented)"

  704. let mk_dinterval f =
  705.   "-dinterval", Arg.Unit f, " (undocumented)"

  707. let mk_dstartup f =
  708.   "-dstartup", Arg.Unit f, " (undocumented)"

  710. let mk_opaque f =
  711.   "-opaque", Arg.Unit f,
  712.   " Does not generate cross-module optimization information\n\
  713.   \     (reduces necessary recompilation on module change)"

  715. let mk_strict_formats f =
  716.   "-strict-formats", Arg.Unit f,
  717.   " Reject invalid formats accepted by legacy implementations (default)\n\
  718.   \     (Warning: Invalid formats may behave differently from\n\
  719.   \      previous OCaml versions, and will become always-rejected\n\
  720.   \      in future OCaml versions. You should always use this flag\n\
  721.   \      to detect invalid formats so you can fix them.)"

  723. let mk_no_strict_formats f =
  724.   "-no-strict-formats", Arg.Unit f,
  725.   " Accept invalid formats accepted by legacy implementations\n\
  726.   \     (Warning: Invalid formats may behave differently from\n\
  727.   \      previous OCaml versions, and will become always-rejected\n\
  728.   \      in future OCaml versions. You should never use this flag\n\
  729.   \      and instead fix invalid formats.)"

  731. let mk_args f =
  732.   "-args", Arg.Expand f,
  733.   "<file> Read additional newline-terminated command line arguments\n\
  734.   \      from <file>"

  736. let mk_args0 f =
  737.   "-args0", Arg.Expand f,
  738.   "<file> Read additional null character terminated command line arguments\n\
  739.           from <file>"

  741. let mk_afl_instrument f =
  742.   "-afl-instrument", Arg.Unit f, "Enable instrumentation for afl-fuzz"

  744. let mk_afl_inst_ratio f =
  745.   "-afl-inst-ratio", Arg.Int f,
  746.   "Configure percentage of branches instrumented\n\
  747.   \     (advanced, see afl-fuzz docs for AFL_INST_RATIO)"

  749. let mk__ f =
  750.   "-", Arg.String f,
  751.   "<file>  Treat <file> as a file name (even if it starts with `-')"

  753. module type Common_options = sig
  754.   val _absname : unit -> unit
  755.   val _no_absname : unit -> unit
  756.   val _alert : string -> unit
  757.   val _I : string -> unit
  758.   val _labels : unit -> unit
  759.   val _alias_deps : unit -> unit
  760.   val _no_alias_deps : unit -> unit
  761.   val _app_funct : unit -> unit
  762.   val _no_app_funct : unit -> unit
  763.   val _noassert : unit -> unit
  764.   val _nolabels : unit -> unit
  765.   val _nostdlib : unit -> unit
  766.   val _nocwd : unit -> unit
  767.   val _open : string -> unit
  768.   val _ppx : string -> unit
  769.   val _principal : unit -> unit
  770.   val _no_principal : unit -> unit
  771.   val _rectypes : unit -> unit
  772.   val _no_rectypes : unit -> unit
  773.   val _safer_matching : unit -> unit
  774.   val _short_paths : unit -> unit
  775.   val _strict_sequence : unit -> unit
  776.   val _no_strict_sequence : unit -> unit
  777.   val _strict_formats : unit -> unit
  778.   val _no_strict_formats : unit -> unit
  779.   val _unboxed_types : unit -> unit
  780.   val _no_unboxed_types : unit -> unit
  781.   val _version : unit -> unit
  782.   val _vnum : unit -> unit
  783.   val _w : string -> unit

  785.   val anonymous : string -> unit
  786. end

  808. end

  997. end;;

  1001.   let list = [
  1002.     mk_a F._a;

  1119. module Make_bytetop_options (F : Bytetop_options) =
  1120. struct
  1121.   let list = [
  1122.     mk_absname F._absname;
  1123.     mk_no_absname F._no_absname;
  1124.     mk_alert F._alert;
  1125.     mk_I F._I;

  1505. [@@@ocaml.warning "-40"]
  1506. ‌let options_with_command_line_syntax_inner r after_rest =
  1507.   let rec loop ~name_opt (spec : Arg.spec) : Arg.spec =
  1508.     let option =
  1509.       match name_opt with
  1510.       | None -> ignore
  1511.       | Some name -> (fun () -> r := name :: !r)
  1512.     in
  1513.     let arg a = r := Filename.quote a :: !r in
  1514.     let option_with_arg a = option (); arg a in
  1515.     let rest a =
  1516.       if not !after_rest then (after_rest := true; option ());
  1517.       arg a
  1518.     in
  1519.     let rest_all a = option (); List.iter arg a in
  1520.     match spec with
  1521.     | Unit f -> Unit (fun a -> f a; option ())
  1522.     | Bool f -> Bool (fun a -> f a; option_with_arg (string_of_bool a))
  1523.     | Set r -> Unit (fun () -> r := true; option ())
  1524.     | Clear r -> Unit (fun () -> r := false; option ())
  1525.     | String f -> String (fun a -> f a; option_with_arg a)
  1526.     | Set_string r -> String (fun a -> r := a; option_with_arg a)
  1527.     | Int f -> Int (fun a -> f a; option_with_arg (string_of_int a))
  1528.     | Set_int r -> Int (fun a -> r := a; option_with_arg (string_of_int a))
  1529.     | Float f -> Float (fun a -> f a; option_with_arg (string_of_float a))
  1530.     | Set_float r ->
  1531.        Float (fun a -> r := a; option_with_arg (string_of_float a))
  1532.     | Tuple [] -> Unit option
  1533.     | Tuple (hd :: tl) ->
  1534.        Tuple (loop ~name_opt hd :: List.map (loop ~name_opt:None) tl)
  1535.     | Symbol (l, f) -> Symbol (l, (fun a -> f a; option_with_arg a))
  1536.     | Rest f -> Rest (fun a -> f a; rest a)
  1537.     | Rest_all f -> Rest_all (fun a -> f a; rest_all a)
  1538.     | Expand f -> Expand f
  1539.   in
  1540.   loop

  1542. ‌let options_with_command_line_syntax options r =
  1543.   let rest = ref false in
  1544.   List.map (fun (name, spec, doc) ->
  1545.     (name,
  1546.      options_with_command_line_syntax_inner r rest
  1547.        ~name_opt:(Some name) spec, doc)
  1548.   ) options

  1550. module Default = struct
  1551.   open Clflags
  1552.   let set r () = r := true
  1553.   let clear r () = r := false

  1555.   module Common = struct
  1556.     let _absname = set Clflags.absname
  1557.     let _alert = Warnings.parse_alert_option
  1558.     let _alias_deps = clear transparent_modules
  1559.     let _app_funct = set applicative_functors
  1560.     let _labels = clear classic
  1561.     let _no_absname = clear Clflags.absname
  1562.     let _no_alias_deps = set transparent_modules
  1563.     let _no_app_funct = clear applicative_functors
  1564.     let _no_principal = clear principal
  1565.     let _no_rectypes = clear recursive_types
  1566.     let _no_strict_formats = clear strict_formats
  1567.     let _no_strict_sequence = clear strict_sequence
  1568.     let _no_unboxed_types = clear unboxed_types

  1643.     let _inline spec =
  1644.       Float_arg_helper.parse spec "Syntax: -inline <n> | <round>=<n>[,...]"
  1645.         inline_threshold
  1646.     let _inline_alloc_cost spec =
  1647.       Int_arg_helper.parse spec
  1648.         "Syntax: -inline-alloc-cost <n> | <round>=<n>[,...]"
  1649.         inline_alloc_cost
  1650.     let _inline_branch_cost spec =

  1660.         "Syntax: -inline-call-cost <n> | <round>=<n>[,...]" inline_call_cost

  1674.         "Syntax: -inline-max-unroll <n> | <round>=<n>[,...]"
  1675.         inline_max_unroll

  1682.         inline_toplevel_threshold
  1683.     let _inlining_report () = inlining_report := true
  1684.     let _insn_sched = set insn_sched
  1685.     let _no_insn_sched = clear insn_sched
  1686.     let _linscan = set use_linscan
  1687.     let _no_float_const_prop = clear float_const_prop
  1688.     let _no_unbox_free_vars_of_closures = clear unbox_free_vars_of_closures
  1689.     let _no_unbox_specialised_args = clear unbox_specialised_args
  1690.     (* CR-someday mshinwell: should stop e.g. -O2 -classic-inlining
  1691.        lgesbert: could be done in main() below, like for -pack and -c, but that
  1692.        would prevent overriding using OCAMLPARAM.
  1693.        mshinwell: We're going to defer this for the moment and add a note in
  1694.        the manual that the behaviour is unspecified in cases such as this.
  1695.        We should refactor the code so that the user's requirements are
  1696.        collected, then checked all at once for illegal combinations, and then
  1697.        transformed into the settings of the individual parameters.
  1698.     *)
  1699.     let _o2 () =
  1700.       default_simplify_rounds := 2;
  1701.       use_inlining_arguments_set o2_arguments;
  1702.       use_inlining_arguments_set ~round:0 o1_arguments
  1703.     let _o3 () =
  1704.       default_simplify_rounds := 3;
  1705.       use_inlining_arguments_set o3_arguments;
  1706.       use_inlining_arguments_set ~round:1 o2_arguments;
  1707.       use_inlining_arguments_set ~round:0 o1_arguments
  1708.     let _remove_unused_arguments = set remove_unused_arguments
  1709.     let _rounds n = simplify_rounds := (Some n)
  1710.     let _unbox_closures = set unbox_closures
  1711.     let _unbox_closures_factor f = unbox_closures_factor := f
  1712.     let _verbose = set verbose
  1713.   end

  1715.   module Compiler = struct
  1716.     let _a = set make_archive
  1717.     let _annot = set annotations
  1718.     let _args = Arg.read_arg
  1719.     let _args0 = Arg.read_arg0
  1720.     let _binannot = set binary_annotations
  1721.     let _c = set compile_only
  1722.     let _cc s = c_compiler := (Some s)
  1723.     let _cclib s = Compenv.defer (ProcessObjects (Misc.rev_split_words s))
  1724.     let _ccopt s = Compenv.first_ccopts := (s :: (!Compenv.first_ccopts))
  1725.     let _cmi_file s = cmi_file := (Some s)
  1726.     let _config = Misc.show_config_and_exit
  1727.     let _config_var = Misc.show_config_variable_and_exit
  1728.     let _dprofile () = profile_columns := Profile.all_columns
  1729.     let _dtimings () = profile_columns := [`Time]
  1730.     let _dump_into_file = set dump_into_file
  1731.     let _dump_dir s = dump_dir := Some s
  1732.     let _for_pack s = for_package := (Some s)
  1733.     let _g = set debug
  1734.     let _no_g = clear debug
  1735.     let _i = set print_types
  1736.     let _impl = Compenv.impl
  1737.     let _intf = Compenv.intf
  1738.     let _intf_suffix s = Config.interface_suffix := s
  1739.     let _keep_docs = set keep_docs
  1740.     let _keep_locs = set keep_locs
  1741.     let _linkall = set link_everything
  1742.     let _match_context_rows n = match_context_rows := n
  1743.     let _no_keep_docs = clear keep_docs
  1744.     let _no_keep_locs = clear keep_locs
  1745.     let _noautolink = set no_auto_link
  1746.     let _o s = output_name := (Some s)
  1747.     let _opaque = set opaque
  1748.     let _pack = set make_package
  1749.     let _plugin _p = plugin := true
  1750.     let _pp s = preprocessor := (Some s)
  1751.     let _runtime_variant s = runtime_variant := s
  1752.     let _stop_after pass =
  1753.       let module P = Compiler_pass in
  1754.         match P.of_string pass with
  1755.         | None -> () (* this should not occur as we use Arg.Symbol *)
  1756.         | Some pass ->
  1757.           match !stop_after with
  1758.           | None -> stop_after := (Some pass)
  1759.           | Some p ->
  1760.             if not (p = pass) then
  1761.               Compenv.fatal "Please specify at most one -stop-after <pass>."
  1762.     let _save_ir_after pass =
  1763.       let module P = Compiler_pass in
  1764.         match P.of_string pass with
  1765.         | None -> () (* this should not occur as we use Arg.Symbol *)
  1766.         | Some pass ->
  1767.           set_save_ir_after pass true
  1768.     let _thread = set use_threads
  1769.     let _verbose = set verbose
  1770.     let _version () = Compenv.print_version_string ()
  1771.     let _vnum () = Compenv.print_version_string ()
  1772.     let _where () = Compenv.print_standard_library ()
  1773.     let _with_runtime = set with_runtime
  1774.     let _without_runtime = clear with_runtime
  1775.   end

  1777.   module Toplevel = struct

  1780.       Printf.printf "The OCaml toplevel, version %s\n" Sys.ocaml_version;

  1782.     ;;

  1786.       raise (Compenv.Exit_with_status 0);
  1787.     ;;

  1860.   module Main = struct

  1862.     let vmthread_removed_message = "\
  1863. The -vmthread argument of ocamlc is no longer supported\n\
  1864. since OCaml 4.09.0.  Please switch to system threads, which have the\n\
  1865. same API. Lightweight threads with VM-level scheduling are provided by\n\
  1866. third-party libraries such as Lwt, but with a different API."

  1868.     include Core
  1869.     include Compiler
  1870.     let _compat_32 = set bytecode_compatible_32
  1871.     let _custom = set custom_runtime

  1875.     let _dllpath s = dllpaths := ((!dllpaths) @ [s])
  1876.     let _make_runtime () =
  1877.       custom_runtime := true; make_runtime := true; link_everything := true
  1878.     let _no_check_prims = set no_check_prims
  1879.     let _output_complete_obj () =
  1880.       output_c_object := true;
  1881.       output_complete_object := true;
  1882.       custom_runtime := true
  1883.     let _output_complete_exe () =
  1884.       _output_complete_obj (); output_complete_executable := true
  1885.     let _output_obj () = output_c_object := true; custom_runtime := true
  1886.     let _use_prims s = use_prims := s
  1887.     let _use_runtime s = use_runtime := s
  1888.     let _v () = Compenv.print_version_and_library "compiler"
  1889.     let _vmthread () = Compenv.fatal vmthread_removed_message
  1890.   end
